TopicTitle: Fixed Decoupler for KSP x64 on Windows - v4 - (July 22)

Articles.Content:
Stock KSP on windows 64 bit has a bug with the decouplers. They don't apply any force when they separate.

This mod implement 2 new decoupler module that replace the stock decouplers.

You need to install ModuleManager to replace the stock module in all the parts. MM patch files included.

Download : https://ksp.sarbian.com/div/DecoupleForX64.zip

Source : https://github.com/sarbian/DecoupleForX64

Licence : The MIT License (MIT)

Edited July 22, 2014 by sarbian

Stock decoupler is ok for now. But with TweakableEverything it doesn't work. This may be a problem of TweakableDecouplers.cfg or TweakableDecouplers.dll file.

I think this is problem in TweakableDecouplers.dll and how it changes ejection force.

Yes, make a DecoupleForX64 directory in GameData an copy the files there.

Removing "TweakableDecouplers.cfg" and "TweakableDecouplers.dll" from TweakableEverything directory and decouplers are working with this fix.

Hey, this was quick! But now they are not tweak able anymore. So this is to be fixed in TweakableEverything.

Well, after some more testing it seems that there could be a problem with it.

On a simple craft (1man pod, decoupler, fueltank, engine) everything works perfectly. But when I try to launch Kerbal X(Stock) (one of the default vehicles in sandbox mode) the radial decouplers donÃ‚Â´t work. Even activating them with rightclick menu does not work.

Clean install, only MM2.2 & decoupler fix v2, win64

edit: as much as I appreciate 64bit version finally beeing here, it seems to have opened a new can of worms;). Kind of a pandoras box...
